questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'mitigate'?
questions.explanation: Mitigate means to make something less severe; the opposite is to 'intensify' or make it more severe.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'lucid'?
questions.explanation: Lucid means clear and easy to understand; 'confused' is the best direct opposite in terms of mental clarity.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'escalate'?
questions.explanation: To escalate is to increase or intensify; 'diminish' is a precise antonym meaning to decrease.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'benevolent'?
questions.explanation: Benevolent means kind and well-meaning; 'cruel' is a direct moral opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'transient'?
questions.explanation: Transient means short-lived or temporary; 'permanent' is its clearest antonym.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'candid'?
questions.explanation: Candid means open and honest; 'evasive' means avoiding direct answers.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'frugal'?
questions.explanation: Frugal means economical and sparing with resources; 'extravagant' means spending excessively.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'apathetic'?
questions.explanation: Apathetic means showing little or no interest; 'passionate' means having very strong feelings.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'succinct'?
questions.explanation: Succinct means brief and to the point; 'wordy' means using too many words.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'reverent'?
questions.explanation: Reverent means showing deep respect; 'irreverent' means showing a lack of respect.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'arduous'?
questions.explanation: Arduous means very difficult and requiring great effort; 'effortless' is the strongest opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'credible'?
questions.explanation: Credible means believable; 'implausible' means not seeming reasonable or probable.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'discreet'?
questions.explanation: Discreet means careful and prudent; 'indiscreet' is the direct opposite, meaning careless in revealing information.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'equitable'?
questions.explanation: Equitable means fair and impartial; 'unfair' captures the core opposite concept.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'staunch'?
questions.explanation: Staunch means very loyal or firm; 'fickle' means changing one's loyalties or feelings frequently.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'wary'?
questions.explanation: Wary means cautious and alert to danger; 'trusting' means inclined to believe or rely on others easily.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'temperate'?
questions.explanation: Temperate means moderate or self-restrained; 'extreme' conveys the opposite of moderation.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'impartial'?
questions.explanation: Impartial means neutral and fair; 'biased' means showing favoritism.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'profuse'?
questions.explanation: Profuse means abundant; 'sparse' means thinly distributed or scant.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'vindicate'?
questions.explanation: Vindicate means to clear from blame; 'condemn' means to declare someone guilty or wrong.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'conspicuous'?
questions.explanation: Conspicuous means easily seen or noticed; 'inconspicuous' means not readily noticeable.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'forthright'?
questions.explanation: Forthright means direct and straightforward; 'evasive' means avoiding direct answers.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'tenacious'?
questions.explanation: Tenacious means holding firmly; 'yielding' means giving way or not holding firmly.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'cursory'?
questions.explanation: Cursory means quick and superficial; 'thorough' means complete and detailed.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'amiable'?
questions.explanation: Amiable means friendly and pleasant; 'hostile' means unfriendly or antagonistic.
